snippet: President Jacob Zuma’s office said Sunday that South Africa would send 400 soldiers to the Central African Republic to help it deal with a threat from rebel groups.
abstract: South Africa President Jacob Zuma’s office says country will send 400 soldiers to Central African Republic to help it deal with a threat from rebel groups.
lead_paragraph: President Jacob Zuma’s office said Sunday that South Africa would send 400 soldiers to the Central African Republic to help it deal with a threat from rebel groups.

headline.seo: South Africa: 400 Troops Headed to Central African Republic
headline.main: South Africa: 400 Troops Headed to Central African Republic
headline.print_headline: South Africa: 400 Troops Headed To the Central African Republic
